page.title: 08LLANGADOG - THE EISTEDDFOD
page.content: On Good Friday and Easter Saturday an Eisteddfod is held in the Community Centre in Llangadog.The Eisteddfod is an eagerly awaited annual event where people sing,recite and play musical instruments in competition.Large crowds come to the Eisteddfod and the competitors come from a wide area.On Good Friday the competition starts at 4.pm and are for competitors up to the age of 18.There are two competitions (singing and reciting) confined to the children of Llangadog C.P.School.On Saturday the highlight of the Eisteddfod is the chairing ceremony when a chair is presented to the poet who wins the poetry competition. The first Eisteddfod took place in 1914 and has taken place every year since then.It has been held in a tent, the old Y.M.C.A.hall,Gosen Chapel,and now in tne Community Centre.
